009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * This is an implementation of the algebraic circle fitting algorithm described in [1].
022 * This algorithm is among the oldest and simplest algebraic circle fitting methods.
023 * This implementation closely follows the original paper. The only difference is the
024 * use of a numerical solver (as compared to using the inverse of matrix M) for
025 * solving the 3x3 linear system.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * Its performance is sufficient if points are sampled over a large part of the circle.
029 * It shows significant bias (estimated circles are too small) when sample points are 
030 * confined to a small segment of the circle. It fails when matrix M becomes singular.
031 * Fits to exactly 3 (non-collinear) points are handled properly.
032 * Data centering is used to improve numerical stability (alternatively, a reference
033 * point can be specified).
034 * </p>
035 * <p>
036 * [1] I. Kåsa. "A circle fitting procedure and its error analysis",
037 * <em>IEEE Transactions on Instrumentation and Measurement</em> <strong>25</strong>(1), 
038 * 8–14 (1976).
039 * </p>
040 * 
041 * @author WB
042 * 
043 */
044public class CircleFitKasaA implements CircleFitAlgebraic {
045
046        private final double[] q;       // q = (A,B,C,D) algebraic circle parameters
047        
048        /**
049         * Constructor.
050         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point.
051         * 
052         * @param points sample points
053         */
054        public CircleFitKasaA(Pnt2d[] points) {
055                this(points, null);
056        }
057        
058        /**
059         * Constructor.
060         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point for data
061         * centering if {@code null} is passed for {@code xref}.
062         * 
063         * @param points sample points
064         * @param xref reference point or {@code null}
065         */
066        public CircleFitKasaA(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
067                this.q = fit(points, xref);
068        }
069        
070        @Override
071        public double[] getParameters() {
072                return q;
073        }
074        
075        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] pts, Pnt2d xref) {
076                final int n = pts.length;
077                if (n < 3) {
078                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 3 points are required");
079                }
080                
081                if (xref == null) {
082                        xref = PntUtils.centroid(pts);
083                }
084                final double xr = xref.getX();
085                final double yr = xref.getY();
086
087                // calculate sums:
088                double sx = 0, sy = 0;
089                double sxy = 0, sxx = 0, syy = 0;
090                double sxxx = 0, syyy = 0;
091                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
092                        final double x = pts[i].getX() - xr;
093                        final double y = pts[i].getY() - yr;
094                        final double x2 = sqr(x);
095                        final double y2 = sqr(y);
096                        sx   += x;
097                        sy   += y;
098                        sxx  += x2;
099                        syy  += y2;
100                        sxy  += x * y;
101                        sxxx += x2 * x + y2 * x;        // = x^3 + x * y^2
102                        syyy += y2 * y + x2 * y;        // = y^3 + x^2 * y
103                }
104                
105                double sz = sxx + syy;
106                
107                double[][] X = {                                // = D in the paper
108                                { 2 * sx,  2 * sy,  n},
109                                { 2 * sxx, 2 * sxy, sx},
110                                { 2 * sxy, 2 * syy, sy}};
111            
112                double[] b = {sz, sxxx, syyy};   // RHS vector (= E in the paper)
113                
114                // find exact solution to 3x3 system M * q = b (using a numerical solver):
115                double[] qq = Matrix.solve(X, b); // = Q in the paper, qq = (B,C,D)
116                
117                double B = -2 * qq[0];
118                double C = -2 * qq[1];
119                double D = -qq[2];
120                
121                // re-adjust for data centering
122                RealMatrix M = CircleFitAlgebraic.getDecenteringMatrix(xr, yr);
123                return M.operate(new double[] {1, B, C, D});    // q = (A,B,C,D)
124        }
125
126}
